issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: After Upgrading from 3.2.2 to 3.3, RightAWS API call to start EBS-backed instances returned an error

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I ran the following constant load over the weekend: 10 async Instance store run instance threads 4 async BFEBS run instance threads After running that load the system is in a state where reported resources from euca-describe-availability-zones verbose and what can actually be run are not lining up. When instances fail to launch I am seeing: {code} [2013-07-30 21:11:12,879] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Attempting to run ebs image Image:emi-6CCD4032 in group default [101m TESTUNIT FAILED: MyTestTraceback (most recent call last): File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eutester-0.0.7-py2.6.egg/eutester/eutestcase.py", line 275, in run ret = self.method() File "./test_script", line 34, in MyTest self.reservation = self.tester.run_instance(self.image, min=1, max=1,keypair=self.keypair_name, timeout=600) File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eutester-0.0.7-py2.6.egg/eutester/__init__.py", line 343, in methdecor return func(*func_args, **func_kwargs) File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eutester-0.0.7-py2.6.egg/eucaops/ec2ops.py", line 2320, in run_instance monitoring_enabled=enabled) File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto-2.5.2-py2.6.egg/boto/ec2/image.py", line 255, in run additional_info=additional_info) File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto-2.5.2-py2.6.egg/boto/ec2/connection.py", line 707, in run_instances return self.get_object('RunInstances', params, Reservation, verb='POST') File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto-2.5.2-py2.6.egg/boto/connection.py", line 1000, in get_object raise self.ResponseError(response.status, response.reason, body) EC2ResponseError: EC2ResponseError: 406 Not Acceptable RunInstancesTypeFailed to allocate resources in the zone cluster1, it is currently locked for maintenance.java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to allocate resources in the zone cluster1, it is currently locked for maintenance. fields.summary: Instances no longer launching after longterm BFEBS churn testing

comments.body:
Looks like first record of this error was few days ago 2013-07-28 22:57:35. CC was running with INFO log level so its log does not have information regarding maintenance mode. I was able to start the same instance right now few times in a row.
Switched CLC and CC to DEBUG level to see if any new errors will pop up.
I was able to trigger problem while trying to simultaneously execute 5 bfebs instances
Also for some reason on this set up euca-describe-nodes shows all instances that were running on nodes. It should show only running one.
[~vasya] are you commiting this fix or is [~decker]?

Fix cluster gating concurrency issue EUCA-7103
49988ee51d744e0c9e69fda5333308f23c6f60b3
No longer seeing this after 3 days of churn.
